Constant Field Values
Method Detail

wrapString

public static java.lang.String[] wrapString(java.lang.String string,
                                            int lineLength)
This method wraps a string so that it will fit under a certain length. The String will be returned as a String array, with each array member being one line of the wrapped text. The String will only be cut at word boundaries. The lineLength must be greater than 0 or else an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
string - is the String to wrap.
lineLength - is the maximum length of each line after wrapping.
Returns:
an array of Strings representing the wrapped String will be returned.

repeatChar

public static java.lang.String repeatChar(int length,
                                          char c)
This static method creates a string from one character repeated for a certain length.

Parameters:
length - is the length of the resultant string.
c - is the character to repeat.
Returns:
the string of length length and with charcter c is returned.

pluralize

public static java.lang.String pluralize(int i,
                                         java.lang.String string)
This method takes an integer i and a String string and concats the two with a space between them. If i is plural then an s is appended onto the end of string. The resulting string is returned.

Parameters:
i - is the integer.
string - is the string.
Returns:
a string of the form i string(s) is returned. The (s) will be present if i is plural.

getCountString

public static java.lang.String getCountString(int i)
This method takes a number and turns it in to a count by appending st, nd, rd, or th on the end of it.

Parameters:
i - is the integer to turn into a count string.
Returns:
the count string is returned.

indexOfIgnoreCase

public static int indexOfIgnoreCase(java.lang.String s,
                                    java.lang.String target)
This method finds and returns the first index of target in s. In this check, case is ignored. If target is not found then -1 is returned.

Parameters:
s - is the string to search through.
target - is the string to look for.
Returns:
the index of target in s is returned. If target is not in s then -1 is returned.

startsWithIgnoreCase

public static boolean startsWithIgnoreCase(java.lang.String s,
                                           java.lang.String target)
This method checks to see if String s starts with String target. When performing the check, case is ignored.

Parameters:
s - is the string to check.
target - is the target string to look for.
Returns:
true is returned if s starts with target, not taking the case of the characters into account.

indexNotOf

public static int indexNotOf(java.lang.String string,
                             int target,
                             int beginIndex)
